channel.title: Blogs on Introduction
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Introduction

item.title: MicroPython running on NXP VF6XX_M4 core
item.description: MicroPython running on NXP VF6XX M4 Core This is an experimental port of MicroPython for NXP VF6XX M4 Core. Source code Supported features include: - REPL (Python prompt) over UART2. - Garbage collector. - GPIO, UART support. Build instructions The tool chain required for the build is the Linaro provided ARM Embedded toolchain, e.g. 4.9 2015 Q3 update. Unpack the toolchain to an appropriate location. e.g. your home directory:

item.title: libsoc examples
item.description: Cross-compiling libsoc: Cross-compiling libsoc examples: Colibri VF61 The Colibri VF50 and VF61 are both SODIMM sized computer modules based on the Qualcomm/NXP/Freescale Vybrid embedded System-on-Chip (SoC). The Vybrid SoC features a Cortex-A5 processor supporting a clock frequency of up to 500MHz. The Colibri VF61 additionally features a second Cortex-M4 processor core which can be clocked at up 167MHz maximum.

item.title: Knuckles demo application fork from DirectFB examples
item.description: Fork of DirectFb example Knucles, which used in Linux quick boot demo. Source code

item.title: Understanding Linux LCD display timings
item.description: Mapping LCD/TFT display timings to Linux Kernel data structures Most of the LCD/TFT display datasheets provide the following timing information: Horizontal Back Porch(HBP): Number of pixel clk pulses between HSYNC signal and the first valid pixel data. Horizontal Front porch(HFP): Number of pixel clk pulses between the last valid pixel data in the line and the next hsync pulse. Vertical back porch(VBP): Number of lines (HSYNC pulses) from a VSYNC signal to the first valid line.

item.title: Point of Sale example application with GTK+ and Glade
item.description: POS Demo Point of sale demo applicaiton example with GTK+ and Glade running on Toradex Apalis/Colibri System On Modules. Source Code available at: pos-demo

item.title: Configuring Embedded Linux machine as WiFi Hotspot
item.description: Configuring Embedded Linux machine as WiFi Hotspot Test Setup: Colibri VF61 V1.1A Colibri Evaluation Board V3.1a/Iris V1.1 Ambicom WL250N-USB Wireless 802.11b/g/n (V1.0a) During boot or upon insertion the following kernel messages identify Ambicom WL250N-USB stick: [ 10.153746] usb 1-1.1: new high speed USB device number 3 using fsl-ehci [ 10.299135] usb 1-1.1: New USB device found, idVendor=148f, idProduct=3070 [ 10.309882] usb 1-1.1: New USB device strings: Mfr=1, Product=2, SerialNumber=3 [ 10.
